name: Istaroth
desc: Ruler of Time, also known as Tokoyo Ookami ( "the thousand winds of time") and Kairos ("the ruler of the unchanging world"). She is presumably one of the shades of the Primordial One.

customize.text:
Shades
Istaroth is presumably one of the four shades created by

customize.name: Primordial One
customize.desc: The First Descender, who defeated seven Dragon Sovereigns of the world and created people. The Primordial One may be Phanes.

customize.text:
Istaroth was the only one who didn't leave the people of Byakuyakoku when they fell into the Dark Sea. According to a legend, the sage Abrax created
with Istaroth's guidance.

customize.name: Makoto
customize.desc: Raiden Ei's twin sister and the previous Electro Archon, also known as Baal. She died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text: Istaroth presumably helped Raiden Makoto to plant the Sacred Sakura seed.

The Thousand Winds Temple, where ancient people worshipped Time and Wind, is located in Mondstadt. Tokoyo Oomikami is the personification of the "undying wind," and the current Anemo Archon, Barbatos, is one of the Thousand Winds.

customize.name: Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds
customize.desc: An educational tome written by anonymous early inhabitants who worshiped the wind. It has been blessed by the wind for its faithfulness and influence over the millennia.

customize.name: Sacrificial Sword
customize.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Greatsword
customize.desc: A ceremonial greatsword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Fragments
customize.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Bow
customize.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.
